unnormalised: **Renewable Energy Sector Sees Robust Growth, Driven by Government Initiatives**
normalised: **Renewable Energy Sector Sees Robust Growth, Driven by Government Initiatives**

unnormalised: New Delhi, India – The renewable energy sector in India is experiencing significant expansion, fueled by ambitious governmental targets and private sector investment. A recent report released by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) on 10/10/2024 indicates a 15% increase in installed renewable energy capacity compared to the previous fiscal year.
normalised: New Delhi, India – The renewable energy sector in India is experiencing significant expansion, fueled by ambitious governmental targets and private sector investment. A recent report released by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E) on tenth october two thousand and twenty four indicates a fifteen percent increase in installed renewable energy capacity compared to the previous fiscal year.

unnormalised: Key projects include the development of a 500 MW solar park in Rajasthan and the establishment of several wind energy farms along the Tamil Nadu coastline. The Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) has sanctioned loans worth Rs. 15,000 crore for various green energy projects, targeting completion by 31/12/2025.
normalised: Key projects include the development of a five hundred megawatt solar park in Rajasthan and the establishment of several wind energy farms along the Tamil Nadu coastline. The Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (I R E D A) has sanctioned loans worth rupees fifteen thousand crore for various green energy projects, targeting completion by thirty first december two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: "India is committed to achieving its net-zero emissions target by 2070," stated Dr. Sharma, Director of MNRE, during a press briefing held at 11:00 hrs today. "These investments will further bolster our efforts to reduce reliance on fossil fuels and promote a sustainable energy future for generations to come. The initiatives also align with the Panchamrit goals announced during COP26." The government aims to achieve 500 GW of renewable energy capacity by 2030, which will power economic growth and improve energy access for rural communities.
normalised: "India is committed to achieving its net-zero emissions target by two thousand and seventy," stated Doctor Sharma, Director of M N R E, during a press briefing held at eleven zero zero hours today. "These investments will further bolster our efforts to reduce reliance on fossil fuels and promote a sustainable energy future for generations to come. The initiatives also align with the Panchamrit goals announced during C O P twenty six." The government aims to achieve five hundred gigawatt of renewable energy capacity by two thousand and thirty, which will power economic growth and improve energy access for rural communities.
